Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk accountsservice
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: control-center, accountsservice, gnome-settings-daemon, libgnomekbd update
Vulnerability.Description: The control-center packages contain configuration utilities for the GNOME desktop, which allow to configure accessibility options, desktop fonts, keyboard and mouse properties, sound setup, desktop theme and background, user interface properties, screen resolution, and other settings. The accountsservice project provides a set of D-Bus interfaces for querying and manipulating user account information. It is based on the useradd, usermod, and userdel commands. The gnome-settings-daemon packages contain a daemon to share settings from GNOME to other applications. It also handles global key bindings, as well as a number of desktop-wide settings. The gnome-bluetooth packages contain graphical utilities to setup, monitor and use Bluetooth devices. The gnome-desktop3 package contains an internal library, libgnomedesktop, used to implement some portions of the GNOME desktop, and also some data files and other shared components of the GNOME user environment. The gsettings-desktop-schemas package contains a collection of GSettings schemas for settings shared by various components of a desktop. The libgnomekbd package contains a GNOME library, which manages keyboard configuration and offers various widgets related to keyboard configuration. The compat-gnome-desktop314 package is a compatibility package with gnome-desktop 3.14 libraries. The control-center packages have been updated to version 3.22.2, the accountsservice packages to version 0.6.45, the gnome-settings-daemon packages to version 3.22.2, the gnome-bluetooth packages to version 3.20.1, the gnome-desktop3 packages to version 3.22.2, the gsettings-desktop-schemas packages to version 3.22.0, and the libgnomekbd packages to version 3.22.0.1. In addition, this update adds the compat-gnome-desktop314 packages to Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7. For detailed information on changes in this release, see the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.4 Release Notes linked from the References section. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
